title: Repeated "Discarded bad propagated block" with eth.syncing "false"
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.6.5`
OS & Version: Windows 7 x64
Commit hash : (if `develop`)

#### Expected behaviour
After
geth --rpc --fast --cache 8192

geth should be in sync mode

#### Actual behaviour
eth.syncing is false
and geth is giving following error as below

Same problem for me also.
Geth version: 1.6.5
OS & Version: Windows 7 x64
Try to use ssd and reconnect to fast and reliable connection.

Hi .. same .. but my network is very good and stable ...
Please advise

I thought it was normal but after 10 days continuous it is failed. In my case, when I got near the latest block several millions continuous "Imported new state entries" forced me to stop the process (see this issue #14647). And when I restart geth in full mode it start from number=1 :(. 

My advice NEVER EVER sync with geth in fast mode if your network cannot sync in few hours. Else who knows it is waste of time. Use geth in full mode or use parity in warp (now it is default) mode. But remember geth in full mode will take many weeks.

I exported from last try of geth full mode till block 2468704 and imported it in parity and started parity from this point. Let's see what happens.

###Edit
I have the best block in 6 hours. :)
